intro: Correa speciosa var. glabra, commonly known as the smooth correa, is a flowering plant native to southeastern Australia. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its lance-shaped, smooth leaves that are typically dark green. The plant produces clusters of tubular, pink to red flowers that bloom in spring, attracting nectar-feeding birds and insects. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and coastal landscapes. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is often cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
